content: bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com sew the legs on between the 4th and 5th row from the center bottom beginning row i do the arms first so i can see where the middle of the body is going to be then start stitching the leg from the center of the body towards the hip sew the tail to the back of the body with the bottom of the tail at the 5th row from the center bottom the tail should assumedly cover part of the back seam but it doesn t usually work out that way page 9 of 11 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com start sewing the inner edge of the ear on the head at the 3rd row from the center then extending outwards note if you are making a monkey set the ears lower on the head completed body page 10 of 11 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com to do the face i use black 4 ply yarn i cut a long piece separate it into 2 strands it gets twisty when you separate it and use that to make a face you can also use embroidery thread or make the face out of felt and sew it on with sewing thread have fun and be creative page 11 of 11 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com
